It is vital to get to the objective truth - and this paper from the Lancet is an important description of the international comparisons

8/8

I look forward to the Inquiry and welcome the Terms of Reference published yesterday. The Inquiry will be an important opportunity to learn from all that happened, so we are as prepared as we can be should there be another pandemic

7/8

The NHS performance was also vital, and the rapid development of life-saving treatments, like Dexamethasone.

6/8

The rapid vaccine programme, and the biggest testing system in the world were undoubtedly important in this

The shielding programme doesn’t get enough attention. We identified, communicated with, and supported over 2 million of the most vulnerable - saving many lives

5/8

The UK recorded deaths with covid, and measured very carefully. The ability to measure the cause of death varies. And people tragically die in pandemics of other causes - like not being able to access cancer treatment

4/8

Each and every death is a heartbreak for a family, so this is important to get right. On this rigorous measure, the UK performed better than many of our near neighbours, and within the UK, England performed marginally better than Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland.

3/8

Throughout the pandemic, @CMO_England always said the only way to judge the number of deaths was not the recorded figure but total excess deaths

2/8

This important new paper published in the Lancet is the first rigorous analysis of the UK’s performance in the pandemic, when it comes to excess deaths
